architectural_notes: Domain/subdomain values must be normalized to a URL-safe slug (letters, numbers, hyphens only; no spaces) and validated before deployment.
known_issues: App not accessible when an invalid domain containing spaces (e.g., "ai master") is used; deployment may succeed but app won’t open.

existing_features.title: Add a repository-level validation step that checks the deployment slug in `frontend/deploy/custom-domain.json` meets the documented domain rules (5–50 chars; only letters, numbers, and hyphens; no spaces/dots/special characters) and fails the build/deploy workflow with a clear English error message when invalid.

Improve domain setup guidance in `frontend/README.md` by adding a short, explicit troubleshooting section explaining that using a domain with spaces (e.g., "Ai master") may result in a deployment that succeeds but an app that cannot be opened, and instruct users to use a DNS-safe slug such as "ai-master".

new_feature_requests.summary: Validate and enforce domain naming rules (no spaces; allow letters/numbers/hyphens) and block/guide invalid domain inputs
Improve domain setup UX: clearer prompt/confirmation when user selects a suggested valid domain and ensure it’s applied before build/deploy

projectName: Enforce valid custom-domain slug rules and guide invalid domain inputs
